TopicTitle: No way to select a monitor with a multi-monitor setup

Articles.Content:
Two different behaviors observed:

1) KSP2 launches on the right-most monitor (not primary). Splash screen, then game, normal loading and startup, just on the wrong monitor.

2) KSP2 splash screen loads on right-most monitor, bit warning screen and main screen load on center/primary monitor, but no mouse. You can navigate the game on the center/primary monitor by moving the mouse around to the releative positions on the right-most monitor (as if the game were running there).  This can be "corrected" by alt-tab out of the game and back in, then the screens refresh and the game renders fully on the right-most (secondary) monitor.

I have swapped the monitor cables and the same behavior occurs. The game always runs on Right-most monitor regardless of cabling or which monitor is set to Primary in windows.  IE if I unplug 3rd (right most monitor) but set 1st monitor (left-most) as Primary, game will run on center monitor (Right-most connected monitor).  Appears to be a bug that KSP2 always wants to run only on the right-most available monitor and not on the Primary.

All other Steam games launch on primary (center) monitor as expected when in three monitor configuration. 

Windows 11 Pro 22621.1555

Z790 AORUS Elite AX; 12th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-12700KF   3.60 GHz

EVGA GeForce RTX 3090; Driver Version 531.61

Edited July 9, 2023 by Anth12
According to https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/PlayerCommandLineArguments.html, you should perhaps have a try starting the game from the command line using the -monitor N option.

Reported Version: v0.1.3 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro 10.0.19045 64-bit | CPU: 13th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-13900K (32) | GPU: AMD Radeon RX 7900 XT (20423MB) | RAM: 65276

 

I have three monitors, KSP insists on using the wrong monitor.  With the previous versions, I was able to use a Unity command line option to select a monitor:

KSP2_x64.exe -single-instance -popupwindow -adapter 2 -no-singlethreaded

I've tried using adapter numbers 0 through 4, nothing changes

Edited June 23, 2023 by Anth12

I've managed to get a workaround for this working.

  1. Create a shortcut of the KSP2 executable, it can be in the same directory
  2. Right-click on the shortcut, select Properties
  3. In the Target field, add the following  AFTER the command: 
-single-instance -no-singlethreaded -popupwindow -adapter 0 -window-mode borderless

So, for example, since my game is located in:

R:\KSP2_0.1.3, my entry would look like: 

R:\KSP2_0.1.3\KSP2_x64.exe -single-instance -no-singlethreaded -popupwindow -adapter 0 -window-mode borderless

While this works for me, it's possible that the -monitor option is better, in that case, according to Unity docs, the option would be a 1-based value (ie:  1, 2, 3, etc)
